verbose_text: Because a malignant undifferentiated population of Oct4 positive embryonic carcinoma (EC) cells has been shown to be ultimately responsible for the proliferation of teratomas derived from the injection of mouse iPS cells in immunocompromised mice XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR (and therefore, they should be described as bona fide teratocarcinomas) we explored whether metformin exposure could reduce the EC component of poorly differentiated, primitive appearing, blast like teratocarcinoma stem cells in a Oct4 related manner.
evidence: metformin exposure could reduce the EC
